Keywords: Armor , Brute , Horsemen , Monster
Real Name: Dr. Bruce Banner
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Destroy Blocking, Characters
THE SECOND HORSEMAN: WAR: If an opposing character was damaged this turn, modify Hulk's attack +1. If an opposing character was KO'd this turn, modify his attack +2 instead.
RAGE GIVEN PURPOSE, BRUTALITY GIVEN FORM: Charge, Flurry.
LIKE LAMBS TO THE SLAUGHTER: Blades/Claws/Fangs. When Hulk uses it, also deal damage equal to half the d6 result to each untargeted opposing character adjacent to Hulk.
SINGLE-MINDED BRUTALITY: STOP. Invulnerability, Regeneration. SAFEGUARD: opposing Probability Control.

vamroc
[QUOTE=Buckwheat;12164277]Can anyone tell me why he's not a 'Scientist', even though he earned a PhD, conducting groundbreaking research in the field of gamma radiation?[/QUOTE] He not a scientist because this is one of those instances where "Banner" and "Hulk" are distinctly separate entities within Bruce's body, when "Hulk" takes control of Banner's body Banner has no idea how he got to wherever it is the Hulk decided to let Banner take control again. Apocalypse installed mental barriers to insure "Banner" was effectively locked out and couldn't take control of the Hulk so Hulk became a slave to Apocalypse's brainwashing without Banner stepping in to fight off such mental control

November 1, 2021
Hellboy the Bellboy
*edit* reread the trait. If a friendly character damages an opposing character he has less than average attack value for his points. If an opposing character is KO'd he'll have a slightly higher than average attack value for his points. I personally think if anyone will have an attack modifier that rolls over turns it would be Horseman of War Hulk.

Keep in mind Hulk's Horseman trait doesn't say "until end of turn". So he'll quickly have a permanent +3 to attack.
October 30, 2021
Buckwheat
I don't think that he can hold up in a 300 point game. With that attack value, you need to bring some Perplex and PC if you want to hit anything. You can't count on drawing blood, consistently, with your remaining 75 points, in hopes of boosting his attack value. Unlike a lot of characters in his weight class, he doesn't have any Invincible, so you can knock his block off with penetrating damage. I think that he'll struggle to pull his weight in games under 500 points.
October 27, 2021
Goop
This Hulk is all kinds of bonkers. His dial is all over the place but he does follow the basic Hulk principle. Start a little weak, become a terror later on. Dont be scared off by the starting low attack, as long as he's attacking last he will likely be an 11. Those middle clicks are just ridiculous, hitting for like 14/6 flurry is just scary, giant size willpower too. However 225pts is a lot so he will likely only be making appearances in very high point games.
